metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3200 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
mod_auth in lighttpd before 1.4.36 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary log entries via a basic HTTP authentication string without a colon character, as demonstrated by a string containing a NULL and new line character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-mysql-vhost - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
lighttpd-mod-webdav - 1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lighttpd package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.35-4ubuntu2.1+esm1').
